hero.title: Forms that do more than paper
hero.lead: Digital tattoo and piercing forms with required-field logic, under-18 protection, signatures and clean documentation.
hero.note: Not “a PDF to print”. A workflow that prevents mistakes and creates proper records.

overview.title: What makes TattooMate forms stand out
overview.lead: Most problems don’t happen during tattooing – they happen because information is missing, workflows are wrong, or documentation is weak.

o1.title: Required logic instead of luck
o1.text: Validation and required fields ensure nothing is missing before the form can be submitted.

o2.title: Under-18 handled properly
o2.text: For minors, guardian fields, signatures and required uploads become mandatory automatically.

o3.title: PDFs reproducible at any time
o3.text: The studio can generate a PDF from the stored data at any time – without asking the client again.

types.title: Which forms are included
types.lead: Tattoo and piercing forms are included in the base package. Additional forms such as tooth jewelry can be added optionally. The workflow always stays the same: clean, traceable and safe.

tattoo.title: Tattoo form
tattoo.lead: Consent, medical information and signatures – structured and complete.
tattoo.b1: Client data, contact details, date of birth
tattoo.b3: Consents and studio texts (loaded dynamically from settings)
tattoo.b5: Design, stencil and reference images stored per consent
tattoo.b6: Signature(s) captured directly in the form
tattoo.b7: Touch-ups documented with a separate signature and date (legally separated)

piercing.title: Piercing form
piercing.lead: Piercing-specific questions including special cases – without forgetting anything.
piercing.b2: Relevant medical information (e.g. blood pressure, allergies, etc.)
piercing.b4: Option to record a rejection with documented reason

tooth.title: Tooth jewelry form
tooth.lead: Tooth-jewelry-specific questions with clear risk disclosure and clean documentation.
tooth.b1: Dental status (e.g. cavities, gum issues, dental restorations)
tooth.b2: Relevant medical information and allergies (e.g. adhesive, latex, nickel)
tooth.b3: Risk information such as enamel damage or detachment
tooth.b4: Consent and signature specifically for tooth jewelry

safety.title: Protection built into the workflow
safety.lead: The strength is not “digital”. The strength is that TattooMate does not allow risky gaps.

card1.title: Validation & required fields
card1.lead: If important information is missing, it won’t be “saved anyway” – the workflow guides the user correctly.
card1.b1: Required fields: name, date of birth, consents, etc.
card1.b2: Conditional fields: details only when needed (e.g. allergies)
card1.b3: Clean structure instead of endless free text

card2.title: Under-18 workflow with blocking
card2.lead: For minors, nothing is waved through. The system enforces the correct process.
card2.b1: Service-specific minimum age (e.g. piercing from 12, tattoo from 18). The age limit is defined per form and determines what is allowed.
card2.b4: Submission is blocked until all required elements are complete

hero.title: Security and control
hero.lead: TattooMate is built to protect data, keep workflows traceable and prevent mistakes.
hero.note: No empty promises. Clear technical and organizational measures.

overview.title: What security really means
overview.lead: Security is more than encryption. Security means control, clear responsibilities and clean workflows.

o1.title: Data stays under control
o1.text: You know where your data is stored, who can access it and what happens to it.

o2.title: Access is clearly regulated
o2.text: Not everyone sees everything. Roles and permissions prevent unnecessary or incorrect access.

o3.title: Errors are prevented
o3.text: Required logic, blocking rules and validation prevent risky gaps in everyday workflows.

data.title: Data storage & hosting
data.lead: TattooMate does not force you into someone else’s cloud. You decide how and where your data is operated.

card1.title: Self-hosting without cloud lock-in
card1.lead: Full control over infrastructure and data – no vendor lock-in.
card1.b1: Operation on your own server or environment is possible
card1.b2: No dependency on external cloud providers
card1.b3: Clear separation between application and marketing website
card1.b4: Suitable for studios with increased data protection requirements

card2.title: Responsible data handling
card2.lead: Only what is actually required is stored.
card2.b1: No unnecessary tracking or analytics scripts
card2.b2: No data sharing with third parties
card2.b3: Personal data remains within the studio context
card2.b4: PDFs and images are protected and not publicly accessible

card3.title: SaaS operation (hosted by TattooMate)
card3.lead: If desired, we operate TattooMate for your studio – without you losing control over your data.
card3.b1: Separate instances per studio (no shared data storage)
card3.b2: No access by third parties to client data or forms
card3.b4: Suitable for studios that do not want to operate their own server

access.title: Access, roles & protection
access.lead: Studios work with multiple people. TattooMate cleanly separates access.

card1.title: Role and permission system
card1.lead: Not every staff member needs access to all functions or data.
card1.b2: Admin area restricted to authorized users
card1.b4: Suitable for teams and guest artists

card2.title: Protected content & images
card2.lead: Images, PDFs and sensitive data are not freely accessible.
card2.b2: Access only with an active session and proper authorization
card2.b4: Especially important for IDs, tattoo and touch-up images

cta.title: Questions about security or operation?
cta.text: I’m happy to explain how TattooMate is operated and which options are available for your studio. Demos are intentionally provided on request only.
